sentence.text: It did not disconcert Sly that he found himself addressing an audience who were all wearing false dingo ears .
Sometimes , she thought she disconcerted Hawk with her love , but he kept apace with her .
She smiled faintly , deciding to disconcert him with humour .

They have a dimension of being beyond the reach of rational formulation , and they often disconcert us by behaving quite differently in one novel , in one volume , from what the previous volume had led us to expect .
Then he disconcerted her by laughing again , but the sound was laced with a derision she found intolerable .

It has been claimed that the vivid pattern of black and white stripes creates a dazzle effect , rather like the Op Art paintings of Bridget Riley and that this disconcerts the attacking predator at close quarters .
The row of figures behind Busacher 's desk disconcerted Gesner for a moment .
The abrupt change of subject disconcerted Celia .
The authority in his childish voice disconcerted her .
He disconcerted her , baffled and enraged her , sparked off her fighting spirit .
Hari asked softly and Edward looked down at her with a shrewdness that disconcerted her .
This new benignity and tolerance a little disconcerted him .
Bob 's gaze disconcerted him .
The voice rather than the words disconcerted Mapleton .
The question , coming as it did unexpectedly at the end of her monologue , disconcerted me .
Charlotte was immediately disconcerted by this hint of mourning and was grateful when Natasha smiled and stepped back , inviting her to enter .
` That is n't me -- it 's my twin sister , " Claudia said simply , to be immediately disconcerted by the disbelieving look in his eyes .
Meredith was disconcerted by his unsmiling reaction because people did n't usually stay immune to her friendly warmth .
Juliet looked up sharply from a display of pot plants , and was disconcerted by the rush of colour to her cheeks .
This seemed to disconcert de Nesle somewhat , for he got up again and walked round the room the other way .
Small girls can be found playing at ` house " , disconcerting their feminist mothers .
They were watching her intently , with a look that disconcerted her and excited her at the same time .
The extent of her fury disconcerted her fleetingly , fully alive and as fulminatingly intense as ever , despite all the years that had gone by since she had last felt like this .
People disconcerted him because they could surprise him .
The sight of Dalziel and Pascoe had disconcerted him more than he had cared to show .
What will disconcert readers who come to Pound after Eliot , what they will find either refreshing or exasperating , is the literalness of Pound 's imagination .
It was bad enough to have to produce a mother who smelled of hens , worse to have all one's guests disconcerted by the beady eyes of an old countrywoman .
Mr Taylor , bursting through the trees , came to an abrupt halt , disconcerted by the scene before him .
